required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Selonsertib in Combination With Prednisolone Versus Prednisolone Alone in Participants With Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis (AH)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Double-Blind, Randomized Study Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy of GS-4997 in Combination With Prednisolone Versus Prednisolone Alone in Subjects With Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis (AH)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of selonsertib (GS-4997) in combination with prednisolone versus prednisolone alone in participants with severe alcoholic hepatitis (AH).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent (TE) Adverse Events (AE), Serious AEs (SAE), AEs Leading to Premature Study Drug Discontinuation, and Grade 3 or 4 Laboratory Abnormalities
primary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that occurred during the course of the trial after study treatment had started. An adverse event was therefore any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug. An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, are life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or results in disability/incapacity, and congenital anomaly/birth defect. Laboratory toxicity grading was based on Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 4.03.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Died by Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who died by Day 28 was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Died by Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who died by Week 8 was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Died by Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who died by Week 12 was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Died by Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who died by Week 24 was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Survival at Day 28 Using Kaplan-Meier
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with survival at Day 28 using Kaplan-Meier was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Survival at Week 8 Using Kaplan-Meier
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with survival at Week 8 using Kaplan-Meier was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Survival at Week 12 Using Kaplan-Meier
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with survival at Week 12 using Kaplan-Meier was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Survival at Week 24 Using Kaplan-Meier
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with survival at Week 24 using Kaplan-Meier was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Received a Liver Transplant
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who received a liver transplant by week 24 was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hepatorenal Syndrome (HRS)
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of HRS was confirmed based on the following diagnostic criteria from the International Ascites Club (IAC): 1) Cirrhosis with ascites, 2) Diagnosis of acute kidney injury (AKI) according to the ICA-AKI criteria, 3) Absence of shock, 4) No current or recent treatment with nephrotoxic drugs, and 5) Absence of parenchymal renal disease as indicated by proteinuria >500 mg/day, microhematuria (> 50 red blood cells per high power field) and/or abnormal renal ultrasonography.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Infection
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of bacterial, fungal, or viral infections was recorded. An infection was considered definite in participants with clinical evidence of infection and a positive culture from a normally sterile source (with the exception of spontaneous bacterial peritonitis).

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of Hospital Stay
secondary_outcome.description: Length of initial hospital stay from first dose date of study drug was calculated for participants who were released from initial hospitalization separately from those who died during their initial hospitalization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Liver Biochemistry Tests: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at endpoint minus the value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Liver Biochemistry Tests: Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at endpoint minus the value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Liver Biochemistry Tests: Gamma Glutamyl Transferase (GGT)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at endpoint minus the value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Liver Biochemistry Tests: Alkaline Phosphatase
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at endpoint minus the value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Liver Biochemistry Tests: Bilirubin
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at endpoint minus the value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Liver Biochemistry Tests: Albumin
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at endpoint minus the value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Liver Biochemistry Tests: International Normalized Ratio (INR)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at endpoint minus the value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Lille Response (Score < 0.45) at Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe alcoholic hepatitis (AH) were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). The Lille score was calculated using baseline factors: age, albumin, total bilirubin, serum creatinine, prothrombin time; and the change in total bilirubin between baseline (Day 1) and Day 7. Lille response was defined as having a Lille score < 0.45.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Lille Null Response (Score ≥ 0.56) at Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe AH were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). The Lille score was calculated using baseline factors: age, albumin, total bilirubin, serum creatinine, prothrombin time; and the change in total bilirubin between baseline (Day 1) and Day 7. Lille null response was defined as having a Lille score ≥ 0.56.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lille Score at Day 7 as a Continuous Variable
secondary_outcome.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe AH were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). The Lille score was calculated using baseline factors: age, albumin, total bilirubin, serum creatinine, prothrombin time; and the change in total bilirubin between baseline (Day 1) and Day 7.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Estimated Mortality at Month 2 and Month 6: Combined Scoring Including Lille Score at Day 7 and Baseline Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 7 Time Points used to calculate Overall Mortality Risk at Months 2 and 6
secondary_outcome.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe AH were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). MELD scores are used to assess prognosis and suitability for liver transplantation. Scores can range from 6 to 40, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. A scoring system combining the Lille score at Day 7 and the baseline MELD score was used to calculate the percentage of participants expected to die by Month 2 and by Month 6.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Prognostic Index: Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Score
secondary_outcome.description: MELD scores are used to assess prognosis and suitability for liver transplantation. Scores can range from 6 to 40, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at endpoint minus the value at Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Prognostic Index: Child-Pugh-Turcotte (CPT) Score
secondary_outcome.description: CPT scores are used to assess the severity of cirrhosis. Scores can range from 5 to 15, with higher scores indicating a greater severity of disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Prognostic Index: Maddrey Discriminant Function (DF) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline Maddrey DF score is a prognostic tool used to determine the next step of treatment based on the severity of AH. Maddrey DF score of < 32 indicates mild to moderate AH and a lower chance of death in the next few months. Maddrey DF score of ≥ 32 indicates severe AH and a higher chance of death in the next few months. The score has no bounds.

intervention.description: 18 mg tablet administered orally once daily
40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) administered orally once daily
Selonsertib placebo tablet administered orally once daily

facility.name: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences
Methodist Healthcare Dallas - The Liver Institute
Brighton & Sussex University Hospitals NHS Trust
Hull and East Yorkshire Hospitals NHS Trust
Royal Liverpool & Broadgreen University Hospitals NHS Trust

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled at study sites in Europe and North America. The first participant was screened on 01 September 2016. The last study visit occurred on 31 May 2018.

group.title: Selonsertib + Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received selonsertib (GS-4997) 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

group.title: Placebo + Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received placebo-to-match selonsertib 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

baseline.population: Safety Analysis Set: All participants who were randomized and took at least 1 dose of study drug.

measure.title: Maddrey Discriminant Function (DF) Score
measure.description: Baseline Maddrey Discriminant Function (DF) score is a prognostic tool used to determine the next step of treatment based on the severity of AH. Maddrey DF score of < 32 indicates mild to moderate AH and a lower chance of death in the next few months. Maddrey DF score of ≥ 32 indicates severe AH and a higher chance of death in the next few months. The score has no bounds.
measure.population: Participants with available baseline values were analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent (TE) Adverse Events (AE), Serious AEs (SAE), AEs Leading to Premature Study Drug Discontinuation, and Grade 3 or 4 Laboratory Abnormalities
outcome.description: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that occurred during the course of the trial after study treatment had started. An adverse event was therefore any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not considered related to the study drug. An SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, are life threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or results in disability/incapacity, and congenital anomaly/birth defect. Laboratory toxicity grading was based on Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 4.03.
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set included participants who were randomized and took at least 1 dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Died by Day 28
outcome.description: The percentage of participants who died by Day 28 was calculated.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set (participants who took at least 1 dose of study drug, and had histologically-confirmed severe alcoholic hepatitis (AH)) with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Length of Hospital Stay
outcome.description: Length of initial hospital stay from first dose date of study drug was calculated for participants who were released from initial hospitalization separately from those who died during their initial hospitalization.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed. Participants released from initial hospitalization and those who died during initial hospitalization were analyzed separately, so a total of 41 participants and 45 participants were analyzed for the Selonsertib + Prednisolone and Placebo + Prednisolone arms, respectively.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Lille Response (Score < 0.45) at Day 7
outcome.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe alcoholic hepatitis (AH) were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). The Lille score was calculated using baseline factors: age, albumin, total bilirubin, serum creatinine, prothrombin time; and the change in total bilirubin between baseline (Day 1) and Day 7. Lille response was defined as having a Lille score < 0.45.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set

group.title: Selonsertib + Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received selonsertib (GS-4997) 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

group.title: Placebo + Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received placebo-to-match selonsertib 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Lille Response (Score < 0.45) at Day 7
measure.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe alcoholic hepatitis (AH) were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). The Lille score was calculated using baseline factors: age, albumin, total bilirubin, serum creatinine, prothrombin time; and the change in total bilirubin between baseline (Day 1) and Day 7. Lille response was defined as having a Lille score < 0.45.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set

analysis.method_desc: Fisher's exact test (2-sided) was used to explore differences between groups in the percentage of participants with response/non-response.

outcome.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe AH were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). The Lille score was calculated using baseline factors: age, albumin, total bilirubin, serum creatinine, prothrombin time; and the change in total bilirubin between baseline (Day 1) and Day 7. Lille null response was defined as having a Lille score ≥ 0.56.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set

outcome.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe AH were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). The Lille score was calculated using baseline factors: age, albumin, total bilirubin, serum creatinine, prothrombin time; and the change in total bilirubin between baseline (Day 1) and Day 7.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.title: Selonsertib + Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received selonsertib (GS-4997) 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

group.title: Placebo + Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received placebo-to-match selonsertib 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

measure.title: Lille Score at Day 7 as a Continuous Variable
measure.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe AH were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). The Lille score was calculated using baseline factors: age, albumin, total bilirubin, serum creatinine, prothrombin time; and the change in total bilirubin between baseline (Day 1) and Day 7.
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Estimated Mortality at Month 2 and Month 6: Combined Scoring Including Lille Score at Day 7 and Baseline Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Score
outcome.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe AH were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). MELD scores are used to assess prognosis and suitability for liver transplantation. Scores can range from 6 to 40, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. A scoring system combining the Lille score at Day 7 and the baseline MELD score was used to calculate the percentage of participants expected to die by Month 2 and by Month 6.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 7 Time Points used to calculate Overall Mortality Risk at Months 2 and 6
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

group.title: Selonsertib + Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received selonsertib (GS-4997) 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

group.description: Participants received placebo-to-match selonsertib 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Estimated Mortality at Month 2 and Month 6: Combined Scoring Including Lille Score at Day 7 and Baseline Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Score
measure.description: The Lille score is a tool used to predict which participants with severe AH were not responding to corticosteroid therapy. It ranges between 0 and 1, with low scores (< 0.16) indicating complete response or positive response to steroids (continue therapy) and high scores (≥ 0.56) indicating no response or poor response to steroids (stop therapy). MELD scores are used to assess prognosis and suitability for liver transplantation. Scores can range from 6 to 40, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. A scoring system combining the Lille score at Day 7 and the baseline MELD score was used to calculate the percentage of participants expected to die by Month 2 and by Month 6.
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Prognostic Index: Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Score
outcome.description: MELD scores are used to assess prognosis and suitability for liver transplantation. Scores can range from 6 to 40, with higher scores indicating greater disease severity. Change from Baseline was calculated as the value at endpoint minus the value at Baseline.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available baseline and any postbaseline data were analyzed.

group.title: Selonsertib + Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received selonsertib (GS-4997) 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Prognostic Index: Child-Pugh-Turcotte (CPT) Score
outcome.description: CPT scores are used to assess the severity of cirrhosis. Scores can range from 5 to 15, with higher scores indicating a greater severity of disease
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available baseline and any postbaseline data were analyzed.

group.title: Selonsertib + Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received selonsertib (GS-4997) 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Prognostic Index: Child-Pugh-Turcotte (CPT) Score
measure.description: CPT scores are used to assess the severity of cirrhosis. Scores can range from 5 to 15, with higher scores indicating a greater severity of disease
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available baseline and any postbaseline data were analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Prognostic Index: Maddrey Discriminant Function (DF) Score
outcome.description: Baseline Maddrey DF score is a prognostic tool used to determine the next step of treatment based on the severity of AH. Maddrey DF score of < 32 indicates mild to moderate AH and a lower chance of death in the next few months. Maddrey DF score of ≥ 32 indicates severe AH and a higher chance of death in the next few months. The score has no bounds.
outcome.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available baseline and any postbaseline data were analyzed.

group.description: Participants received selonsertib (GS-4997) 18 mg tablet orally once daily + prednisolone 40 mg (4 x 10 mg tablets) orally once daily for 28 days.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Prognostic Index: Maddrey Discriminant Function (DF) Score
measure.description: Baseline Maddrey DF score is a prognostic tool used to determine the next step of treatment based on the severity of AH. Maddrey DF score of < 32 indicates mild to moderate AH and a lower chance of death in the next few months. Maddrey DF score of ≥ 32 indicates severe AH and a higher chance of death in the next few months. The score has no bounds.
measure.population: Participants in the Full Analysis Set with available baseline and any postbaseline data were analyzed.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events: Up to Day 28 plus 30 days; All-Cause Mortality: Up to 24 weeks
reported_events.desc: Safety Analysis Set included all participants who were randomized and took at least 1 dose of study drug.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: After conclusion of the study and without prior written approval from Gilead, investigators in this study may communicate, orally present, or publish in scientific journals or other media only after the following conditions have been met: The results of the study in their entirety have been publicly disclosed by or with the consent of Gilead in an abstract, manuscript, or presentation form; or The study has been completed at all study sites for at least 2 years
